newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil gov't coffee auction to total 20,023 bags.
newsitem.headline: Brazil gov't coffee auction to total 20,023 bags.

text.p: Brazil's government will auction 20,023 60-kg bags of its coffee stocks on August 28, said a Banco do Brasil spokesman.
The auction will take place at 1400 local/1700 GMT and will consist of seven lots, according to the auction document.
Most of the coffee (10,909 bags) is currently warehoused in Sao Paulo state. A further 8,750 bags are in Parana warehouses and the remaining 364 bags are in Espirito Santo.
The coffee to be put up for auction comes from harvests ranging from 1986/87 to 1988/89.
The auction, open to exporters, domestic roasters and the soluble coffee industry, is the second in a series of monthly auctions to be held throughout the coffee year (July/June).
The limit for each auction is 200,000 bags but the actual quantity of each sale should reflect the supply situation prevailing at the time.
Given the fact the 1996/97 coffee harvest is well underway, traders had not expected a large quantity to be put up for sale this month.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
